name: places/ChIJiePzNq1ZwokRWlec_8oT1JU
formattedAddress: 337 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 337 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

editorialSummary.text: Straightforward rooms in a laid-back lodging offering complimentary hot breakfast & Wi-Fi.

originalText.text: The only good things about this hotel is the location, and the price. Other than that, this was a horrible hotel experience for us! When we arrived, we were switched rooms at least 3 times. The first was because we were given a key card to a room someone else was already in, which is so awkward and an invasion of privacy! Our bed sheets were dirty when we arrived and the bathroom seemed as though it had not been swept or cleaned very throughly. We asked for clean sheets and a broom to take care of it ourselves. During our 2 day stay they were also replacing all the TVs in the rooms which was difficult because we were working remotely and were interrupted during live meetings for it. The business center was a tiny room that didn't really fit our needs so we couldn't go there either. The workers there are very kind and seem to be trying their best in a really crappy situation. The breakfast is okay and very crowded. Our key cards got deactivated 3 times and we were only there for 2 nights. But worst of all was the elevator situation. You have to plan on around 6-8 minutes at least in order to use the elevator. Is it SO SLOW and there are only 2. The doors randomly would open and stop at floors where no one was. The bottom level of the staircase said that it could be unlocked using your key card, but it only seemed to open with the employee's cards so that ruled out the stairs. And considering we were on the 21st floor, stairs were not something we wanted to do anyways with luggage and such. Overall, it was not a very pleasant experience. Like I said, the workers were kind and were doing the best that they could! This hotel does not meet the standards that I feel most Hampton Inns do though. So be prepared for it to be a potentially rough stay.

originalText.text: For a central downtown hotel this was perfect for our three nights. Good maids, comfortable bed, decent shower etc. Room needed a general refurbish but delivered our needs in terms of allowing us to get out and about easy, with plenty of places to eat nearby and walking distance to subway etc. Breakfast included, although their carbon footprint is very high as everything is served with paper plates and plastic cutlery, maybe because the kitchen is too small to handle proper plates/cutlery? - not good for Hilton's image.

originalText.text: Hello. My family came to visit for my son's birthday. The rooms and hotel were very clean, the rooms are smaller but it's New York. The staff provided exceptional customer service. They decorated the room for my son's birthday. Overall 5/5 service received. Thank you so much to the management and staff.

They decorated the room for my son's birthday. Overall 5/5 service received. Thank you so much to the management and staff.

originalText.text: Stayed two nights for new years- rooms were a little small but to be expected for the location and price. Clean & safe and convenient. The desk staff were all phenomenal. James specifically went way above & beyond to make our stay memorable & stress free. We love him!

text.text: Stayed two nights for new years- rooms were a little small but to be expected for the location and price. Clean & safe and convenient. The desk staff were all phenomenal. James specifically went way above & beyond to make our stay memorable & stress free. We love him!

originalText.text:
We rented two rooms for two nights and had a really nice stay here.
The rooms are small but that is very normal for NYC.
We had an excellent stay and this hotel us a great value for the cost!
Would highly recommend.
The staff were incredibly warm and responsive, the rooms were clean and the free breakfast was wonderful!
